intro: Chiococca latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf chiococca, is a climbing plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant produces woody capsules that contain numerous small, elliptical seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
